name: Tunica-Biloxi Tribe of Louisiana - Language & Culture Revitalization Program
description: Offers Tunica language classes, online classes, and a summer youth camp. They also have a Cultural & Educational Resources Center (CERC) Library
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Chitimacha Tribe of Louisiana
description: Engaged in language revitalization efforts, including classes taught at their tribal school and early learning center. They have also partnered with Rosetta Stone for language learning software
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Coushatta Tribe of Louisiana
description: Offers Koasati language classes through their Heritage Department and provides language learning materials, including an app and dictionary
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Jena Band of Choctaw Indians
description: While specific language instruction details are not readily available, they are a federally recognized tribe in Louisiana involved in cultural preservation
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Isle de Jean Charles Band of Biloxi-Chitimacha-Choctaw Indians
address: (No specific business address listed for language instruction, but the tribe is located in Terrebonne Parish, Louisiana)
description: This tribe is involved in cultural preservation and language revitalization efforts, though specific class offerings are not detailed as a business
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: École Pointe-au-Chien
address: (Temporary location at Vision Christian Center in Bourg, LA, with plans for a permanent location at the old Pointe-aux-Chenes Elementary)
description: This is the first Indigenous French immersion school in Louisiana, serving a predominant Native American population. While focused on French, it serves the Indigenous community's language needs
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Lafourche Parish Indian Education Department
description: This department provides Native language instruction, tribal history instruction, and culturally designed summer camps for eligible students
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma (Louisiana Programs)
description: While primarily based in Oklahoma, the Choctaw Nation offers online Choctaw language classes and resources that may be accessible to individuals in Louisiana. They also have a "School of Choctaw Language" dedicated to preservation
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: The MICA Group (Grantee Programs)
description: The MICA Group provides grants to tribal language programs. While not a direct instruction provider, they support many American Indian language initiatives in Louisiana
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation

name: Tulane University - Tunica Language Project
description: A collaborative project with the Tunica-Biloxi Tribe to revitalize the Tunica language, developing materials and resources
services: American-Indian-owned Language instruction in Louisiana consultation
